title: Non OP champs? (list)
body:
We always say "Yi is broken wtf riot" "OMFG GAREN"S ULT DID HALF MY HEALTH" "WTF how can it be legal for vayne to be an ADC and an assassin, thats like having an water/electric type pokemon"
so lets compile a list of all the champs that no-one complains about and see just how many champs are "in a good place" balance wise 

and please don't just say your main and say "but he isn't op" you know if your main gets complaints or not, i main azir and he isn't in this list because people complain, you don't have to agree but because they complain he doesn't go in the list.

ok so i think that these champs are not complained about enough and so much be in a good place 
(feel free to contest these and/or add)

Ashe
Bard
Brand
Braum
Gangplank 
Janna
Karma
Kassadin
Kennen
Lulu
Nami
Nautilus 
Nocturne
Quinn
Rammus
Reksai
Shen
Singed
Sion
Sivir
Soraka
Tahm Kench
Taric
Twisted Fate
Zac
Zilean
Zyra

Obviously they are strong when fed but so is everyone, these are champions that are not complained about consistently like Yi, Blitz etc are, and so are ones the community as a whole are happy with.

replies.body: I really have to agree with you. Even though these champs can do insane damage if played right they never get complained about. Nice List
Most champs are op in the right hands.

Braum is DEFINITELY OP, his passive is broken as all hell and a non-ultimate 16 sec cooldown can negate an entire teams damage for several secs including many ultimates.

 Soraka is also on the OP side atm, both of these supports are seeing more and more play competitively across the regions.

 Gangplanks rework is definitely fucked, even casters are saying it during games. His E being manaless and ignoring 60% armour while being able to crit is garbage without even taking into account the rest of his kit. If they took away the armour pen and gave it a mana cost( even something small like 30) I would consider him in a good spot. Historically when a mana using champ has been given 0mana skills in their kit it has never ended well, leading to spam of the skill and abuse. Remember Lucians dash on release?

TF is broken and heavily banned at most elos and competetive play, so much power in his ultimate +wave clear.


 The rest of the list seems fine.

 Surprised Trundle isn't on there, I would consider him to be historically one of the most balanced champions in the game of all time. I wouldn't say Gnar is OP at all either as a top laner, can't recall either of these ever being complained about before.
Soraka isn't op if you take her out of the laning phase really early so instead of targeting ADC, target Soraka and she will have trouble till late game.

Put her in a comp that has a beefy front like(tanky top and jungle) and she will make them gods. Even better if the enemy has a champion like Zed or Akali who all in on a friendly player, free silence NO NO zones for days.

 Especially since Spirit Visage was changed to increase healing received from other players.
BTW I should admit, I have started going Targons Soraka lately :3

is there something up with your profile lordsesshomaru?  like ive lolkinged you and your boards profile say you are lvl 9 but is pretty clear you are a experienced player. did you know about this or is a glitch or something I don't know about on my side?

I think nasus couldbe on there as you just have to zone him from farm andbuild health as he has 20% passive lifesteal at level 18

also corki,maybe oriana,diana,nami and wuong maybe

I don't hear complaints very often when I play Ashe - epic ult, but it takes some epic skill to make full use of.

I disagree with Aatrox being on there though, there are so many times where I would kill that ugly mug, only to be killed by a tower/team waiting for him to revive (or even worse Aatrox himself). I hate his passive - at least with Anivia's you have a chance to kill her when she's down.
ok i have made the changes, out with Aatrox and in with ashe :P

:)

Aatrox is pretty good aside from the immunity though.

I am quite iffy about Braum since his kit is pretty toxic if the player knows what he's doing.

I also don't think Kass should be on this list, solely because he isn't OP in a sense that he's currently way too UP to be considered balanced.

Is this a list for right now? Because Rek Sai and Zyra were super broken on release, and Kassadin is the most complained about champion in existence. Also I think we should add Ezreal to the list, everything about him is a skill shot. His ult has a huge cast time too, which gives the enemies a massive window for counter play.
garen is up and needs desperate buffs

I don't think Anivia should be there personally. she has been my main for a while now and she is incredibly strong. once you know how to play her there nothing you cant do. the only downsides is that you have no escape unless you have tp and she is really only countered by mobility such as yas. I feel as if her play rate was higher she may get a slight nerf but she is op. then again most champs are if someone knows how to play them. just my opinion {{champion:34}}

I know how powerful she is, i play her a fair bit myself but she isn't my main, she is definitely a monster when played right, i only included her because you dont hear many complaints about her, but that is probably like you mentioned because she isn't seen much, i have removed her from the list to be safe tho thanks.

OMG jayce op, too strong melee too strong ranged
OMG karthus BS ult, rito nerf pls
i have removed jayce and karthus from the list, thank you

My reason for disagreeing with a lot of the champs on that list is because I just feel it all depends on how you play and who you're against rather than that champion being OP or not OP. Majority of the time its everyone raging at _each other_ rather than them blaming the champion itself XD nonetheless, theres always gonna be those champions we all hate. 
*clears throat* {{champion:17}}
